articles.headline: Lawmakers Gird for Next Fiscal Clash, on the Debt Ceiling
articles.snippet: Even as Republicans vow to leverage the federal borrowing limit in their demands for spending cuts, President Obama, who signed the tax bill Wednesday, says he won’t join in more charged talks on the issue.
articles.abstract: Even as Republicans vow to leverage the federal borrowing limit in their demands for spending cuts, President Obama, who signed the tax bill Wednesday, says he won’t join in more charged talks on the issue.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — With the resolution of the year-end fiscal crisis just hours old, the next political confrontation is already taking shape as this city braces for a fight in February over raising the nation’s borrowing limit. But it is a debate President Obama says he will have nothing more to do with.
articles.byline: By Michael D. Shear and Jackie Calmes

articles.headline: Battered by Expensive Crises, Toyota Declares a Rebirth
articles.snippet: Ambitious changes to the automaker’s lineup and resolution of recalls and supply chain issues signal a recovery, the company says.
articles.abstract: Ambitious changes to the automaker’s lineup and resolution of recalls and supply chain issues signal a recovery, the company says.
articles.lead_paragraph: TOKYO — The pink Toyota Crown sedan that took center stage at a holiday event here last week was meant to shock, and it did.
articles.byline: By Hiroko Tabuchi and Bill Vlasic

articles.headline: Al Jazeera Seeks a U.S. Voice Where Gore Failed
articles.snippet: Current TV will provide the pan-Arab news giant with something it has sought for years: a pathway into American living rooms.
articles.abstract: Current TV will provide the pan-Arab news giant with something it has sought for years: a pathway into American living rooms.
articles.lead_paragraph: 9:16 p.m. | Updated Al Jazeera, the pan-Arab news giant, has long tried to convince Americans that it is a legitimate news organization, not a parrot of Middle Eastern propaganda or something more sinister.

articles.headline: A Gigantic Sigh of Relief as Tax Uncertainty Ends
articles.snippet: Congress’s last-minute deal means Americans will pay higher taxes, but they are happy to have the confusion resolved.
articles.abstract: Congress’s last-minute deal means Americans will pay higher taxes, but they are happy to have the confusion resolved.
articles.lead_paragraph: Even though Congress’s last-minute deal means higher taxes for almost all Americans, businesses and consumers are relieved that some of the uncertainty about what they will owe the government this year is gone.

articles.headline: Clinton Out of Hospital After Treatment for Clot
articles.snippet: Doctors said Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clinton would make a full recovery after being treated for several days for a blood clot in a vein in her head.
articles.abstract: Doctors said Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clinton would make a full recovery after being treated for several days for a blood clot in a vein in her head.
articles.lead_paragraph: Hillary Rodham Clinton, whose globe-trotting tour as secretary of state was abruptly halted last month by a series of health problems, was discharged from a New York hospital on Wednesday evening after several days of treatment for a blood clot in a vein in her head.
articles.byline: By Denise Grady and Mark Landler

articles.headline: In China, Grass-Roots Groups Take On H.I.V./AIDS Outreach Work
articles.snippet: Community organizations are slowly facing less resistance from government officials as they offer services to H.I.V.-infected people, many of them gay, a population that is often stigmatized.
articles.abstract: Community organizations are slowly facing less resistance from government officials as they offer services to H.I.V.-infected people, many of them gay, a population that is often stigmatized.
articles.lead_paragraph: GUANGZHOU, China — As he waited to give blood for an H.I.V. test one recent afternoon, Le, a 25-year-old marketing professional, explained why he was there. “I was aware of the consequences” of not using a condom, he said, “but somehow I didn’t know how to say no.”

articles.headline: Some Breaks for Industries Are Retained in Fiscal Deal
articles.snippet: Hollywood, the railroad industry and rum producers benefited from some obscure provisions that survived the deal between the White House and Congress.
articles.abstract: Hollywood, the railroad industry and rum producers benefited from some obscure provisions that survived the deal between the White House and Congress.
articles.lead_paragraph: Nearly $250 million for Hollywood. Over $330 million for the railroad industry. More than $220 million for rum producers. And $62 million for doing business in American Samoa.
articles.byline: By Nelson D. Schwartz and Matthew L. Wald

articles.headline: Energy Shot’s ‘No Crash’ Claim Is Disputed by Watchdog
articles.snippet: An advertising watchdog group says it told the distributor of 5-Hour Energy years ago that a claim that the drink did not cause a letdown once the effects wore off was unfounded.
articles.abstract: An advertising watchdog group says it told the distributor of 5-Hour Energy years ago that a claim that the drink did not cause a letdown once the effects wore off was unfounded.
articles.lead_paragraph: The distributor of the top-selling energy “shot,” 5-Hour Energy, has long claimed on product labels, in promotions and in television advertisements that the concentrated caffeine drink produced “no crash later” — the type of letdown that consumers of energy drinks often feel when the beverages’ effects wear off.

articles.headline: Piecing Together a Tax Plan’s Effects
articles.snippet: The recently concluded federal budget agreement could raise the tax bill for people with incomes over $250,000 by thousands of dollars.
articles.abstract: The recently concluded federal budget agreement could raise the tax bill for people with incomes over $250,000 by thousands of dollars.
articles.lead_paragraph: It is tempting for people who earn less than $400,000 to think that they got off easy this week under the tax deal to end the fiscal impasse, given that only those with incomes above that level will be in a higher income tax bracket in 2013.

articles.headline: In a Soaring Homicide Rate, a Divide in Chicago
articles.snippet: As killings rise on the streets of Chicago, the homicides, most of which the authorities described as gang violence, have not been spread evenly across the city.
articles.abstract: As killings rise on the streets of Chicago, the homicides, most of which the authorities described as gang violence, have not been spread evenly across the city.
articles.lead_paragraph: CHICAGO — This city’s 471st homicide of 2012 happened in the middle of the day, in the middle of a crowd, on the steps of the church where the victim of homicide 463 was being eulogized. Sherman Miller, who was 21, collapsed amid gunfire not far from the idling hearse that was there to carry away James Holman, 32, shot to death a week earlier.

articles.headline: Barnes & Noble Faces Steep Challenge as Holiday Nook Sales Decline
articles.snippet: The company’s Nook unit suffered a 12.6 percent decline in sales compared with the same period a year earlier, a blow to its hopes of building up its digital division to compete with behemoths like Amazon.com.
articles.abstract: The company’s Nook unit suffered a 12.6 percent decline in sales compared with the same period a year earlier, a blow to its hopes of building up its digital division to compete with behemoths like Amazon.com.
articles.lead_paragraph: 8:21 a.m. | Updated For Barnes & Noble, the digital future is not what it used to be.
